Description:
Develop and implement comprehensive safety policies, guidelines, and procedures to ensure compliance with local, state, and federal regulations.
Conduct regular safety inspections and risk assessments of facilities, equipment, and workspaces to identify potential hazards and areas for improvement.
Collaborate with various departments to ensure all safety-related protocols are understood and followed, including emergency response plans and evacuation procedures.
Maintain and update safety records, incident reports, and documentation to track safety performance and trends.
Lead safety training sessions for employees at all levels to educate and raise awareness about safety best practices.
Investigate workplace accidents, incidents, or near misses, and develop corrective action plans to prevent future occurrences.Skills
Skills:
Occupational Health and Safety Knowledge: Comprehensive understanding of health and safety regulations, standards, and best practices relevant to the industry and local laws.
Risk Assessment and Mitigation: Ability to conduct thorough risk assessments to identify potential hazards and develop strategies to mitigate them.
Safety Training and Education: Proficiency in developing and delivering safety training programs to employees at all levels.
Incident Investigation and Analysis: Skill in investigating workplace accidents, incidents, and near misses, and analyzing root causes to prevent recurrence.
Compliance Management: Knowledge of regulatory requirements and the ability to ensure compliance with relevant health, safety, and environmental laws.
Emergency Response Planning: Expertise in developing and implementing emergency response plans and procedures to handle crises effectively.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills to convey safety protocols, policies, and procedures to employees and management.
